content:
Musau saves his
 father 
 
 Kanyiva Sandi
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Once upon a time, there was a smal boy 
 named Musau who lived with his father 
 
 Syonzola. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Syonzola stayed out drinking until very
 late every night and Musau hardly ever
 
 saw him. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When Musau’s father came home,
 
 he would scream, "Vilagers,
 vilagers! Come and rescue me! I am
 being atacked by a hyena."
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 On hearing Syonzola’s screams, 
 
 the vilagers would come with their 
 arows and spears and pangas, to rescue 
 him. 
 
 
 But they would find that he was drunk 
 
 and just teasing them. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Musau’s father continued drinking
 and shouting for help late at night. The
 
 vilagers continued going with arows
 and spears and pangas to rescue him.
 But each time it was the same story. He
 
 would only be teasing them. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Every time Musau’s father 
 returned home late, Musau would be 
 woken by the screams for help. 
 
 Musau knew his father’s voice 
 very wel. 
 He would listen as Syonzola moved in 
 
 the dark until he reached the dor of their 
 house. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One night, Syonzola came home drunk as
 usual. But this time, a hyena hid near the
 house. 
 
 When Syonzola screamed, the hyena
 fiercely atacked him. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Syonzola screamed so loudly. 
 But the vilagers said, "We are tired 
 of Syonzola’s tricks." 
 
 They turned over in their beds and went 
 back to slep. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As usual, Syonzola’s screams 
 
 woke up his son Musau. 
 Musau listened for his father’s 
 steps as he always did. 
 
 But his father did not sem to move 
 closer to the house. Musau sat up and 
 
 listened more kenly. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 "My father is realy in danger,"
 Musau said. "This time he is not
 
 teasing." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Musau jumped up from his bed. 
 He grabed a smoldering log from the 
 
 fire and rushed out of the hut. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 "Father, father," he caled. 
 
 In the monlight, Musau saw Syonzola 
 
 strugling with an animal. He raised the 
 burning log. 
 
 
 When the hyena saw the fiery log, he ran 
 away. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 After that, Syonzola never went out again
 
 to drink. 
 Instead, he spent his days teling
 interesting stories to the schol children.
